name: MX Linux
description: MX Linux is a midweight desktop-oriented Linux distribution based on Debian Stable. It focuses on simplicity, performance, and efficient resource usage, with a friendly user interface built around XFCE.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: MX Linux was founded in 2014 as a collaborative project between antiX and former MEPIS developers. It aimed to combine the best of both systems into a user-friendly desktop experience.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: MX Linux built a reputation for being lightweight yet highly functional. It provides useful custom tools, excellent hardware support, and a stable Debian base.

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: MX Linux consistently ranks highly in popularity on Linux tracking sites. It is appreciated by both new and experienced users for its reliability and ease of use.

sections.title: User-Friendly Toolset
sections.text: MX Linux includes the MX Tools suite, offering GUI utilities for system maintenance, snapshot creation, driver installation, and more, making system management accessible to all.
